name: InsurancePlan
description: Details of a Health Insurance product/plan provided by an organization.

properties.name: InsurancePlan
properties.short: Details of a Health Insurance product/plan provided by an organization
properties.definition: Details of a Health Insurance product/plan provided by an organization.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
properties.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

properties.name: meta
properties.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

properties.name: implicitRules
properties.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
properties.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
properties.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

properties.name: language
properties.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
properties.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

properties.name: text
properties.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
properties.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
properties.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

properties.name: contained
properties.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
properties.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

properties.name: extension
properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: modifierExtension
properties.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
properties.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

properties.name: identifier
properties.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this health insurance product which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

properties.name: status
properties.definition: The current state of the health insurance product.

properties.name: type
properties.definition: The kind of health insurance product.

properties.name: name
properties.definition: Official name of the health insurance product as designated by the owner.
properties.comment: If the name of the product/plan changes, consider putting the old name in the alias column so that it can still be located through searches.

properties.name: alias
properties.definition: A list of alternate names that the product is known as, or was known as in the past.
properties.comment: There are no dates associated with the alias/historic names, as this is not intended to track when names were used, but to assist in searching so that older names can still result in identifying the product/plan.

properties.name: period
properties.definition: The period of time that the health insurance product is available.

properties.name: ownedBy
properties.definition: The entity that is providing  the health insurance product and underwriting the risk.  This is typically an insurance carriers, other third-party payers, or health plan sponsors comonly referred to as 'payers'.

properties.name: administeredBy
properties.definition: An organization which administer other services such as underwriting, customer service and/or claims processing on behalf of the health insurance product owner.

properties.name: coverageArea
properties.definition: The geographic region in which a health insurance product's benefits apply.

properties.name: contact
properties.definition: The contact for the health insurance product for a certain purpose.
properties.comment: Where multiple contacts for the same purpose are provided there is a standard extension that can be used to determine which one is the preferred contact to use.

properties.name: id
properties.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

properties.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. properties.name: purpose
properties.definition: Indicates a purpose for which the contact can be reached.

properties.name: name
properties.short: A name associated with the contact
properties.definition: A name associated with the contact.

properties.name: telecom
properties.short: Contact details (telephone, email, etc.)  for a contact
properties.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the party may be contacted.

properties.name: address
properties.short: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact
properties.definition: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact.

properties.name: endpoint
properties.definition: The technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the health insurance product.

properties.name: network
properties.definition: Reference to the network included in the health insurance product.
properties.comment: Networks are represented as a hierarchy of organization resources.

properties.name: coverage
properties.definition: Details about the coverage offered by the insurance product.

properties.name: type
properties.definition: Type of coverage  (Medical; Dental; Mental Health; Substance Abuse; Vision; Drug; Short Term; Long Term Care; Hospice; Home Health).

properties.name: network
properties.definition: Reference to the network that providing the type of coverage.
properties.comment: Networks are represented as a hierarchy of organization resources.

properties.name: benefit
properties.definition: Specific benefits under this type of coverage.

properties.name: requirement
properties.definition: The referral requirements to have access/coverage for this benefit.

properties.name: limit
properties.definition: The specific limits on the benefit.

properties.name: value
properties.definition: The maximum amount of a service item a plan will pay for a covered benefit.  For examples. wellness visits, or eyeglasses.
properties.comment: May also be called “eligible expense,” “payment allowance,” or “negotiated rate.”.

properties.name: code
properties.definition: The specific limit on the benefit.
properties.comment: Use `CodeableConcept.text` element if the data is free (uncoded) text.

properties.definition: Details about an insurance plan.

properties.name: type
properties.definition: Type of plan. For example, "Platinum" or "High Deductable".

properties.name: coverageArea
properties.definition: The geographic region in which a health insurance plan's benefits apply.

properties.name: network
properties.definition: Reference to the network that providing the type of coverage.
properties.comment: Networks are represented as a hierarchy of organization resources.

properties.name: type
properties.definition: Type of specific benefit (preventative; primary care office visit; speciality office visit; hospitalization; emergency room; urgent care).

properties.name: cost
properties.definition: List of the costs associated with a specific benefit.

properties.name: type
properties.definition: Type of cost (copay; individual cap; family cap; coinsurance; deductible).

properties.name: applicability
properties.definition: Whether the cost applies to in-network or out-of-network providers (in-network; out-of-network; other).

properties.name: qualifiers
properties.definition: Additional information about the cost, such as information about funding sources (e.g. HSA, HRA, FSA, RRA).

properties.name: value
properties.definition: The actual cost value. (some of the costs may be represented as percentages rather than currency, e.g. 10% coinsurance).

searchParameters.name: address
searchParameters.description: A server defined search that may match any of the string fields in the Address, including line, city, district, state, country, postalCode, and/or text

searchParameters.name: address-city
searchParameters.description: A city specified in an address

searchParameters.name: address-country
searchParameters.description: A country specified in an address

searchParameters.name: address-postalcode
searchParameters.description: A postal code specified in an address

searchParameters.name: address-state
searchParameters.description: A state specified in an address

searchParameters.name: address-use
searchParameters.description: A use code specified in an address

searchParameters.name: identifier
searchParameters.description: Any identifier for the organization (not the accreditation issuer's identifier)

searchParameters.name: name
searchParameters.description: A portion of the organization's name or alias

searchParameters.name: owned-by
searchParameters.description: An organization of which this organization forms a part

searchParameters.name: phonetic
searchParameters.description: A portion of the organization's name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

searchParameters.name: type
searchParameters.description: A code for the type of organization
